meanings.sent1: The auric jewelry sparkled in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: She admired the auric coins in the display case.
meanings.sent3: The pirate searched for the hidden auric treasure.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was as precious as auric metal.
meanings.sent5: The auric sunset painted the sky in shimmering hues.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the ear
meanings.sent1: He felt an auric sensation as the wind whispered in his ear.
meanings.sent2: The doctor examined her auric canal for any signs of infection.
meanings.sent3: The auric earmuffs kept her warm in the winter chill.
meanings.sent4: His auric sense picked up the faintest of sounds.
meanings.sent5: The auric sound of the ocean waves lulled her to sleep.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the sense of hearing
meanings.sent1: The auric nerves transmitted the music to his brain.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed the auric experience of listening to a live concert.
meanings.sent3: The auric amplifier made the music sound louder than ever.
meanings.sent4: His auric memory recalled the melody from his childhood.
meanings.sent5: The auric symphony filled the concert hall with beautiful melodies.
